title: The new flow of news : how social network sites transform news organization and citizens political behavior
descriptions:
The grant proposal titled "The new flow of news: how social network sites transform news organization and citizens political behavior" seeks to investigate the impact of social network sites (SNS) on traditional news organizations and citizens' political behavior. With the decline of traditional news sources and the increasing attention given to SNS, this project aims to explore the process and reveal the implications of this industry transition. The proposed new model will focus on the network logic and key actors involved, such as news organizations, news feeders, and news feedees.

Using innovative approaches, big data analysis, and small N in-depth designs, the project will study news organizations through interviews with news editors, traffic data analysis, and content analysis. Additionally, users' behavior will be examined through laboratory observation, surfing behavior measurement, and physiological attention indices. Long-term effects on political beliefs and behaviors will be measured using survey panel data and web-based behavioral data over a two-year period.

The research impact of this project includes a novel conceptualization of news distribution, consumption, and influence, as well as the establishment of new methodological standards in audience research. Overall, this project will provide valuable insights into how the integration of SNS into news platforms is shaping news production and influencing citizens' political behavior.
